body: I wonder if you might be able to work around this by ensuring your docker daemon is setup following these instructions to enable the GPU for docker by default? https://github.com/NVIDIA/nvidia-container-runtime
@tritab yeah thanks I'm going to try this workaround, but with GPU functionality being such a major feature I was hoping there was a way to this directly with the mlflow API.
Hi @ksanjeevan thanks for posting! That's a good point. I think we should have a way to specify extra docker parameters when running docker project.

rename.from: [BUG] Running MLflow training with Docker Env doesn't support GPUs
rename.to: Running MLflow training with Docker Env doesn't support GPUs

body:
@tomasatdatabricks Gotcha, so right now the only way we can do `mlflow run` with GPUs is using conda env correct?

 In that case it could easily work for docker environments as well if we could set on MLproject file something like:
```
docker_env:
    image: my-image
    run_params: [['--gpus', 'all'], ['--other-flag', 'value'], ...]
```
And have `run_params` propagated to wherever mlflow calls `docker run` and just append them.

As for running on gpus - @tritab 's suggestion did not work for you? 

As for adding run params -  Maybe, although I am not sure if we want to specify extra flags in the project file since the projects are supposed to be able to run in different environments. We could also surface docker parameters to the mlflow cli  and let you set the defaults in the MLproject file.

> As for running on gpus - @tritab 's suggestion did not work for you?

Will try it out! After some reading looks like that works for people, so should be a valid workaround... Just wanted a cleaner way to allow for GPU usage, since we want to use a workflow of spinning up machines and automating the training jobs. 

> [...] We could also surface docker parameters to the mlflow cli and let you set the defaults in the MLproject file.

Big 👍. That would cleanly solve all of this and give great flexibility!
Cool, let me know if you would be interested in contributing this update, I'd be happy to review you PR. Otherwise we'll try to get to it soon.

Thanks @tomasatdatabricks. So I've created [this draft pr](https://github.com/mlflow/mlflow/pull/2608) to show how it could work? I didn't go into tests or doc or anything like that, just a straightforward implementation that kinda follows what's being done for `--param-list` :)

It'd be awesome if you guys could implement it. If the general idea of the PR looks good to you but you don't think you'll be able to get to it, I can try to work on it thought it might take me longer. Let me know!
